class.name: Phaser.SoundManager

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: reference to the current game instance.

class.help:
The Sound Manager is responsible for playing back audio via either the Legacy HTML Audio tag or via Web Audio if the browser supports it.
Note: On Firefox 25+ on Linux if you have media.gstreamer disabled in about:config then it cannot play back mp3 or m4a files.
The audio file type and the encoding of those files are extremely important. Not all browsers can play all audio formats.
There is a good guide to what's supported here: http://hpr.dogphilosophy.net/test/

public.name: add
public.help: Adds a new Sound into the SoundManager.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Whether or not the sound will loop.

parameters.name: connect
parameters.help: Controls if the created Sound object will connect to the master gainNode of the SoundManager when running under WebAudio.

public.name: addSprite
public.help: Adds a new AudioSprite into the SoundManager.

public.name: decode
public.help: Decode a sound by its assets key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: Assets key of the sound to be decoded.

parameters.name: sound
parameters.help: Its buffer will be set to decoded data.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Stops all the sounds in the game, then destroys them and finally clears up any callbacks.

public.name: pauseAll
public.help: Pauses all the sounds in the game.

public.name: play
public.help: Adds a new Sound into the SoundManager and starts it playing.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Whether or not the sound will loop.

public.name: remove

returns.help: True if the sound was removed successfully, otherwise false.

public.help: Removes a Sound from the SoundManager. The removed Sound is destroyed before removal.

public.name: removeByKey

returns.help: The number of matching sound objects that were removed.

public.help: Removes all Sounds from the SoundManager that have an asset key matching the given value.\nThe removed Sounds are destroyed before removal.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The key to match when removing sound objects.

public.name: resumeAll
public.help: Resumes every sound in the game.

public.name: stopAll
public.help: Stops all the sounds in the game.

public.name: unlock
public.help: Enables the audio, usually after the first touch.

public.name: update
public.help: Updates every sound in the game.

private.name: setMute
private.help: Internal mute handler called automatically by the Sound.mute setter.

private.name: unsetMute
private.help: Internal mute handler called automatically by the Sound.mute setter.

public.name: channels
public.inlineHelp: The number of audio channels to use in playback.

public.name: connectToMaster
public.inlineHelp: Used in conjunction with Sound.externalNode this allows you to stop a Sound node being connected to the SoundManager master gain node.

public.name: context
public.inlineHelp: The AudioContext being used for playback.

public.name: mute
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the muted state of the SoundManager. This effects all sounds in the game.

public.name: noAudio
public.inlineHelp: Has audio been disabled via the PhaserGlobal object? Useful if you need to use a 3rd party audio library instead.

public.name: onSoundDecode
public.inlineHelp: The event dispatched when a sound decodes (typically only for mp3 files)

public.name: touchLocked
public.inlineHelp: true if the audio system is currently locked awaiting a touch event.

public.name: usingAudioTag
public.inlineHelp: true if the sound is being played via the Audio tag.

public.name: usingWebAudio
public.inlineHelp: true if this sound is being played with Web Audio.

public.name: volume
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the global volume of the SoundManager, a value between 0 and 1.

private.name: _sounds
private.inlineHelp: An array containing all the sounds

private.name: _volume
private.inlineHelp: The global audio volume. A value between 0 (silence) and 1 (full volume).
